verses.roman:
keśa nā dekhiyā bhakta yadyapi pāya duḥkha
saundarya dekhite tabu pāya mahā-sukha

synonyms: keśa—hair; nā dekhiyā—not seeing; bhakta—the devotees; yadyapi—although; pāya—get; duḥkha—unhappiness; saundarya—the beautiful posture; dekhite—to see; tabu—still; pāya—get; mahā-sukha—great happiness.
translation: Although the devotees were unhappy at not seeing the Lord's hair, they nonetheless derived great happiness from seeing His beauty.
